name: ced23b7e-041b-4513-a0d2-f8578b84f77d
displayName: Correcting the transport type on a completed claim

text.text: Can users correct the transport type on a completed claim in ZOLL Billing?

text: Yes, users can correct the transport type on a completed claim in ZOLL Billing. To do this, users must go to the Claim page, click the Incident details tab, and click the edit icon. Users can then change the transport type. If users are changing from a "one-way" to a "did not transport", the mileage is wiped out and no further actions are needed after saving changes. If users are changing from a "did not transport" to a "one-way", they will need to enter a destination in the Incident details tab and manually enter the mileage back in the Charges tab.

text.text: What steps are involved in correcting the transport type on a completed claim?

text: To correct the transport type on a completed claim, users must go to the Claim page, click the Incident details tab, and click the edit icon. Users can then change the transport type. If users are changing from a "one-way" to a "did not transport", the mileage is wiped out and no further actions are needed after saving changes. If users are changing from a "did not transport" to a "one-way", they will need to enter a destination in the Incident details tab and manually enter the mileage back in the Charges tab.

text.text: Is there any specific reason or scenario where users might need to correct the transport type on a completed claim?

text: Users might need to correct the transport type on a completed claim if they are changing from a "did not transport" to a "one-way".

text.text: Are there any limitations or restrictions on when the transport type can be corrected on a completed claim?

text: Users may have to update their location based modifiers after the change.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle changes in the transport type from "one-way" to "did not transport" and vice versa?

text: If users are changing from a "one-way" to a "did not transport", the mileage is wiped out and no further actions are needed after saving changes.

text.text: What happens to the associated mileage information when changing the transport type on a completed claim?

text: If users are changing from a "did not transport" to a "one-way", they will need to enter a destination in the Incident details tab and manually enter the mileage back in the Charges tab.

text.text: Are there any additional fields or information that need to be updated when changing the transport type?

text: Users may have to update their location based modifiers after the change.

text.text: Does ZOLL Billing provide any notifications or alerts to relevant stakeholders when the transport type is corrected on a completed claim?

text: To fix the error(s) on the claim, click the claim number on the notification to go to the Claim page. On the top of the Claim page, you will see a validation banner that explains the error and suggests steps.

text.text: Are there any best practices or guidelines recommended for users when correcting the transport type on completed claims in ZOLL Billing?

text: To get to the Claim page, enter the claim number or patient's last name in the search field and then click the claim number in the search results.

text.text: Are there any audit trails or logs maintained for changes made to the transport type on completed claims?

text: To see the claim audit trail, enter the claim number in Search. When the Claim page displays, click the Audit trail tab.

text.text: Correcting the Transport Type on a Completed Claim

text: To change the transport type, you need to enter a destination in the Incident details tab and manually enter the mileage back in the Charges tab. You also need to click the Save changes button.
